title: league of legends has lost connection to maestro
body: after about 3 minutes after I log into league I get a message that says: League of Legends has lost contact with Maestro. League of Legends will now exit. Please try restarting the client. I've restarted the client multiple times but I still keep getting the error. please help!

replies.body:
Hey pandaaz,

I have somewhat of an interest in this case.
While you should follow the advice and steps outlined in the article Targons Blade showed you, I would very much like to be kept in the loop.

If it works out great ignore the following part please:

***

**If it doesn't pan out**, I have some suggestions you could try out.

#Info

* Can you tell us what Operating system you're using?

#Isolation steps 1-3

1. Step AntiVirus/Firewalls

 * Disable your firewalls and anti virus
 * Then try connecting to League
 * Wait 3-4 minutes for the error.

2. Step Disable programs on startup.

 * I would like for you to disable unnecessary programs on startup, please follow the steps outlined in this video.

https://youtu.be/J4edyL_IJWM

 * Restart your computer and try again.

3. Step Safe mode with networking

 * Go back to msconfig
 * Go to the 'boot' menu
 * Select 'safe start' and tick off the 'network' box
 * Restart your computer and try again

Can you tell me if you got it working, and at which step?

When you lose connection to Maestro, it's typically caused by your connection is dropping on its way to the servers. Local network settings and ISP routing are the primary causes for most of these issues, so as a first step, I recommend working through our [connection guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues). It goes over the most common solutions for this problem.

Let me know if that caused any change.
